name: John WITHERSPOON, Petitioner, v. CITY OF PHILADELPHIA, Respondent

parties: John WITHERSPOON, Petitioner, v. CITY OF PHILADELPHIA, Respondent.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
AND NOW, this 28 th day of April, 1999, we GRANT the Petition for Allowance of Appeal LIMITED to the following issue:
In determining whether the statute of limitations has been tolled, must the court inquire into whether the plaintiff has made good faith efforts to serve process after the initial thirty-day service period has expired?
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Richard G. Freeman, Philadelphia, for petitioner.
casebody.head_matter:
727 A.2d 1113
John WITHERSPOON, Petitioner, v. CITY OF PHILADELPHIA, Respondent.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
April 28, 1999.
Richard G. Freeman, Philadelphia, for petitioner.
